alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 5:31PM EST until March 09 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM EST, Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. - At 528 PM EST, The automated gauge on the Shade River near Chester reported a reading of 17.55 feet and falling. At 17 feet, the Sugar Run Creek Bridge is flooded 200 feet downstream from Oak Hill Road and the Shade River Bridge. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
